title: Primary Grade (K-3) Literacy and Language Arts Instruction in Schools with Diverse Populations
description: Introduction of approaches, strategies, and methods for literacy and language arts instruction for diverse learners in K-3 classrooms. Examination of concepts and theories underlying literacy instruction, and relating research-based patterns of reading and writing development to features of learning environments. Participation in public schools requires mandated fingerprint clearance. 3 seminars, 1 activity.
prerequisites: Senior standing and ENGL 391, or Graduate standing
